body_html:
Hi @rryan ,
I can see that there are two alternatives for processing raw audio waveforms (to obtain spectrograms and mfccs, for example):

  1. audio_ops.audio_spectrogram(), audio_ops.mfcc()
  2. contrib.signal.stft(), some processing, contrib.signal.mfcc_from_log_mel...()

What are the intended / recommended use cases of these two approaches ? It looks confusing to me.
body_text:
Hi @rryan ,
I can see that there are two alternatives for processing raw audio waveforms (to obtain spectrograms and mfccs, for example):

audio_ops.audio_spectrogram(), audio_ops.mfcc()
contrib.signal.stft(), some processing, contrib.signal.mfcc_from_log_mel...()

What are the intended / recommended use cases of these two approaches ? It looks confusing to me.
body:
Hi @rryan , 
I can see that there are two alternatives for processing raw audio waveforms (to obtain spectrograms and mfccs, for example):

1. `audio_ops.audio_spectrogram()`, `audio_ops.mfcc()`
2. `contrib.signal.stft()`, some processing, `contrib.signal.mfcc_from_log_mel...()`

What are the intended / recommended use cases of these two approaches ? It looks confusing to me.
